info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 4:26PM EDT until April 7 at 5:41PM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Elkhorn Creek Near Peaks Mill affecting Franklin County.
.Heavy rain from the past 36 hours has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Elkhorn Creek near Peaks Mill.
* WHEN...From this evening to Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, North Scruggs Lane floods near Elkhorn Campground. At 13.0 feet, Switzer (County 1689) and Indian Gap Roads flood. Goshen Road floods at back entrance to Two Creeks subdivision. At 14.0 feet, Jones Lane floods. Water approaches Georgetown Road (US 460).
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Bankfull is 8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 13.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning to 9.3 feet Saturday evening. It will rise above flood stage again late Saturday evening to 13.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage again late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 06/01/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Friday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY AFTERNOON
